content.div:
We try before you buy! Dose.ca editors are playing guinea pigs to get the 411 on the latest beauty products. This week, we're testing two popular brands of hair serum that promise shiny, frizz-free locks.



Product: Marc Anthony Moisture Gloss (suggested retail price: $9.99 - available at drug stores)

"I've been a die-hard Marc Anthony Moisture Gloss user for a while. I'm not sure if it's the silky smooth texture or the sweet scent that has me hooked, but this serum works wonders! I have naturally dry, colour-damaged hair, and this is great to use both on wet and dry hair. This is not as thick as the OSiS Magic anti-frizz serum, so I could apply the serum liberally and not worry about looking like I hadn't washed my hair in weeks." -Miranda Furtado, style editor, Dose.ca

"The first thing I noticed about this product is the smell: it's delightful! I tried it first on damp hair before blowdrying, and didn't see much of an effect. But when I tried it as a finishing serum (after using a straightening cream and drying/styling my hair), it worked well. It tamed my frizz and gave me incredible shine. The trick is to apply it to dry hair, and then brush it out a bit to get rid of that "greasy" look. I'm definitely using this product the next time I straighten my hair." –Jen McDonnell, managing editor, Dose.ca

"There's no expertise required to apply it; just take a little bit of the gloss, rub your hands together and then run them through your hair. Be warned, though: it's very easy to use too much, so start with a little and add more if you need to. While the Moisture Gloss did provide a really nice sheen, it didn't do much to reduce frizz. It made my hair very nice and shiny for a good few hours, but by the time I got home from work, the effect had mostly worn off and just made my tresses look greasy. The product wasn't a great fit for my hair – sometimes it worked, but the stars had to be aligned properly for that to happen. However, it smelled fantastic." –Kat Angus, TV editor, Dose.ca

"Starting with damp hair, the Marc Anthony Moisture Gloss drops left me with an identical effect to the OSiS serum: I had the same-old natural curls, albeit with a smidge more softness and shine. Applying it to blown-out dry hair, however, I found this product to be a great way to re-invigorate styled hair in seconds. More like an oil than a serum in its consistency, the drops might look greasy when initially applied, but once brushed through the product gave my hair the sort of shampoo-commercial smoothness it only gets after a straightening session with a pro. The effect, however, doesn't last long. That said, the yummy fruity scent will keep on keeping on. (Fairsies?)" -Leah Collins, Music Editor, Dose.ca


Schwarzkopf Professional OSiS Magic Anti-Frizz Serum (suggested retail price: $23.50 - available at salons only)

"I expected to shoot this product down hard since I've been a longtime user of the Marc Anthony Moisture Gloss and could never foresee myself straying, but I was surprised with the results. As a curly haired girl that uses a lot of heat to tame my waves, I need a thick consistency to lock in the moisture and the OSiS Magic anti-frizz serum was just that -- thick and luxurious. I wouldn't recommend this for people who have thinner hair, but this is definitely a great daily addition to anyone who has thick, dry, unruly hair that could use a little extra TLC." -MF

"I tried this on both damp and dry hair, and didn't see much of a difference either way. I guess it reduced my frizz a bit, but did nothing to add shine. I also found this product easier to mess up; apply too much and there's no way to brush it out or get rid of the 'dirty hair' look." –JM

"The OSiS Magic anti-frizz serum did wonders for my hair, as far as frizz was concerned – my hair isn't overly frizzy, but I almost always have flyaways or tiny little hairs sticking up around my forehead. A little bit of the serum and those problems were gone. By the end of the day, my hair was still frizz-free and didn't look tired at all. The serum is really light and glossy, but like the Moisture Gloss, using too much is almost as worse as using none at all. I also found out it worked better if I used it in wet hair than in dry. The anti-frizz serum was certainly my favourite, even if it didn't give my hair the sheen I was hoping for; I'd much rather have frizz-free, normal-looking hair than shiny hair I can't control." -KA

"As promised, my frizzy curls got a little boost of softness and shine from the OSiS Magic serum that lasted all day and into the next morning. Maybe it wasn't "dazzling," as per the product pitch -- or even that much of a change from my hair's usual texture -- but I'll take an improvement, no matter how slight. That said, I've experienced much glossier results from drugstore hair serums. In terms of the product texture, it's a thick-but-slick gel, that I found easy to work through fresh-from-the-shower hair." -LC
